title: Well-Read Lives - central argument of passage

content.question: Which statement best sums up the central argument of the passage?

choices.label: Genres defined as feminine gave women the chance to assert their influence and express themselves.
Diary and letter writing provided women with a foothold in the publishing world.
Women modified traditional genres in the nineteenth century to express a unique point of view.
Women's correspondence provides insightful commentaries on nineteenth-century culture at large.

content.answer: Genres defined as feminine gave women the chance to assert their influence and express themselves.

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Identify and describe the overarching thesis of an argument, and any indication it provides of the argument's structure.
